extendedglmnet 0.1.0
  • Get started
  • Reference

    make predictions from an extendedglmnet object.

    predict.extendglmnet.Rd

    Similar to other predict methods, this functions predicts fitted values and classes (for binary endpoint only) from a fitted "extendedglmnet" object.

    # S3 method for predict
extendedglmnet(
  object,
  newx,
  type = c("link", "class", "response"),
  family = "gaussian",
  levels = c(0, 1)
)

    Arguments

    newx

    Matrix of new values for x at which predictions are to be made. Must be a matrix.

    type

    Type of prediction required. For continuous y's, only predicted responses will be returned. Type "link" gives the linear predictors for "binomial" models. Type "response" gives the fitted probabilities for "binomial" models. Type "class" applies only to "binomial" models, and produces the class label corresponding to the maximum probability.

    family

    can be binomial or gaussian depending on y types.

    levels

    specify the binary response variable levels of factors.

    fit

    Fitted "extendedglmnet" model object.

    Value

    fitted values.

    See also

    extendedglmnet, and print.extendglmnet, and evaluation methods.

    Author

    Weiwei Tao tww101928@gmail.com

    Examples

    
size = 200
x = matrix(rnorm(210*size),ncol=210)
z = 1 + 2*x[,1] + 3*x[,40] - 4*x[,50] + 3*x[,210]
pr = 1/(1+exp(-z))
y = rbinom(size,1,pr)

fit.rl <- extendedglmnet(x, y, family = "binomial", type = "random lasso", q1 = 150, q2 = 150)
ypred.rl <- predict.extendglmnet(fit.rl, x, type="class", family = "binomial")
